segment.source: DISM Unattended Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Unattended Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: DISM Unattended Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Unattended Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: DISM Unattended Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Unattended Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: If you are installing multiple packages to a Windows® image, use DISM to apply an unattend.xml answer file to the image.
segment.target: If you are installing multiple packages to a Windows® image, use DISM to apply an unattend.xml answer file to the image.

segment.source: Some packages require other packages to be installed first.
segment.target: Some packages require other packages to be installed first.

segment.source: If there is a dependency requirement, the best way to ensure the correct order of the installation is by using an answer file.
segment.target: If there is a dependency requirement, the best way to ensure the correct order of the installation is by using an answer file.

segment.source: When you use DISM to apply an unattend.xml answer file to an image, the unattended settings in the offlineServicing configuration pass are applied to the Windows image.
segment.target: When you use DISM to apply an unattend.xml answer file to an image, the unattended settings in the offlineServicing configuration pass are applied to the Windows image.

segment.source: The base syntax for servicing a Windows image using DISM is:
segment.target: The base syntax for servicing a Windows image using DISM is:

segment.source: DISM.exe {/Image:pathto imagedirectory/Online} dismglobaloptions {servicingoption} servicingargument
segment.target: DISM.exe {/Image:pathto imagedirectory/Online} dismglobaloptions {servicingoption} servicingargument

segment.source: The following servicing options are available to apply an unattend.xml answer file to an offline Windows image:
segment.target: The following servicing options are available to apply an unattend.xml answer file to an offline Windows image:

segment.source: The following servicing options are available to apply an unattend.xml answer file to a running operating system:
segment.target: The following servicing options are available to apply an unattend.xml answer file to a running operating system:

segment.source: The following table provides a description of how an unattended servicing option can be used.
segment.target: The following table provides a description of how an unattended servicing option can be used.

segment.source: These options are not case sensitive.
segment.target: These options are not case sensitive.

segment.source: Option
segment.target: Option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /Get-Help
segment.target: /Get-Help

segment.source: When used immediately after an unattended servicing command-line option, information about the option and the arguments is displayed.
segment.target: When used immediately after an unattended servicing command-line option, information about the option and the arguments is displayed.

segment.source: Additional topics might become available when an image is specified.
segment.target: Additional topics might become available when an image is specified.

segment.source: Examples:
segment.target: Examples:

segment.source: Dism /online /Apply-Unattend /?
segment.target: Dism /online /Apply-Unattend /?

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /Apply-Unattend /?
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /Apply-Unattend /?

segment.source: /Apply-Unattend:path_to_unattend.xml
segment.target: /Apply-Unattend:path_to_unattend.xml

segment.source: Applies an Unattend.xml file to an image.
segment.target: Applies an Unattend.xml file to an image.

segment.source: If you are updating device drivers using an unattended answer file, you must apply the answer file to an offline image and specify the settings in the offlineServicing configuration pass.
segment.target: If you are updating device drivers using an unattended answer file, you must apply the answer file to an offline image and specify the settings in the offlineServicing configuration pass.

segment.source: If you are updating packages or other settings using an unattended answer file, you can apply the answer file to an offline or online image.
segment.target: If you are updating packages or other settings using an unattended answer file, you can apply the answer file to an offline or online image.

segment.source: Specify the settings in the offlineServicing configuration pass.
segment.target: Specify the settings in the offlineServicing configuration pass.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /Apply-Unattend:C:\test\answerfiles\myunattend.xml
segment.target: Dism /image:C:\test\offline /Apply-Unattend:C:\test\answerfiles\myunattend.xml

segment.source: Dism /online /Apply-Unattend:C:\test\answerfiles\myunattend.xml
segment.target: Dism /online /Apply-Unattend:C:\test\answerfiles\myunattend.xml

segment.source: Limitations
segment.target: Limitations

segment.source: You cannot use other servicing commands on the same command line with unattended servicing commands.
segment.target: You cannot use other servicing commands on the same command line with unattended servicing commands.

segment.source: Only a single unattend.xml answer file can be specified on any command line.
segment.target: Only a single unattend.xml answer file can be specified on any command line.

segment.source: When you add packages to an image using an unattended answer file, the applicability of the package will not be checked.
segment.target: When you add packages to an image using an unattended answer file, the applicability of the package will not be checked.

segment.source: The answer file will be applied, and the operation will complete even if there are packages specified in the answer file which do not apply to the image.
segment.target: The answer file will be applied, and the operation will complete even if there are packages specified in the answer file which do not apply to the image.

segment.source: If you have to check the applicability of a package when you add it to an image, use the DISM command together with the /Add-Package option without the /ignorecheck option.
segment.target: If you have to check the applicability of a package when you add it to an image, use the DISM command together with the /Add-Package option without the /ignorecheck option.

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Operating System Package Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Operating System Package Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: If you are updating device drivers using an unattended answer file, you must apply the answer file to an offline image.
segment.target: If you are updating device drivers using an unattended answer file, you must apply the answer file to an offline image.

segment.source: When you use DISM.exe to apply an answer file to a running operating system, the answer file should only contain elements in the offlineServicing configuration pass.
segment.target: When you use DISM.exe to apply an answer file to a running operating system, the answer file should only contain elements in the offlineServicing configuration pass.

segment.source: This is because some settings in the Specialize configuration pass might be applied to the operating system.
segment.target: This is because some settings in the Specialize configuration pass might be applied to the operating system.

segment.source: We recommend that the answer file that you use with DISM only contain settings in the offlineServicing configuration pass.
segment.target: We recommend that the answer file that you use with DISM only contain settings in the offlineServicing configuration pass.

segment.source: The recommended way to author answer files is to create them in Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM).
segment.target: The recommended way to author answer files is to create them in Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM).

segment.source: However, if you use a manually authored answer file, you must validate the answer file in Windows SIM to verify that it works.
segment.target: However, if you use a manually authored answer file, you must validate the answer file in Windows SIM to verify that it works.

segment.source: For more information, see Best Practices for Authoring Answer Files.
segment.target: For more information, see Best Practices for Authoring Answer Files.

segment.source: When you apply an answer file by using DISM, the answer file is not cached on the target computer.
segment.target: When you apply an answer file by using DISM, the answer file is not cached on the target computer.
